availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Morrow (Webster Co., ky farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Mary Francis Hutsell Morrow in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on January 1848. Married to Sarah T. Cox Morrow in Hopkins County on February 12, 1854. Father of Mary A. Morrow and William C. Morrow. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 329B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 508.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252406.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages, p. 2.
